title: It would be a lethal mistake if the West shuts its eyes to the Isil 'bloodlands'
text:
When I first visited Yad Vashem, the Holocaust memorial centre in Jerusalem, I was struck by a bleak statistic. Survival rates for Jews in Poland, Lithuania and the occupied parts of the USSR were lower even than in Germany. The Yale historian Timothy Snyder was later to explain why in a grim book called Black Earth.

The most dangerous spaces in the world – not just for vulnerable minorities, but for everyone – are those where there is no functioning state. The Third Reich’s amoral regime still had police, courts and bureaucratic procedures, however illegitimate.
